AD_TorturersInCombat.synopsis: The torture scene with Minthara has devolved into combat, the torturers react on their turn!

AD_FailedInterrogation.synopsis: On Minthara's turn, in combat after failing to pass by an interrogating guard.

Torturer1.synopsis: Sumera loves her job and any excuse to cause a little pain. One-liner after torturing Minthara.
Torturer1.how_to_trigger: Complete the torture situation at 634; -669 and speak to NPC after.

Drow.synopsis: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two drow guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.

PAD_HelpMinthara.synopsis: When party exits Moonrise after Execution scene, if player have not started helping Minthara in any way we play this PAD to remind about her.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture.synopsis: Torturers are waiting in their room. Minthara may or may never arrive depending on story permutations. They discuss about work regardless.

AD_PassedInterrogation.synopsis: Minthara comments on player successfully defusing situation with an interrogating guard during her escape.

Torture.synopsis: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.
Torture.how_to_trigger: Enter Act 2 on the 'Absolute' path, in which the tieflings were killed. Go to Moonrise towers, and enter the execution scene in the audience chamber. Speak up for Minthara and advise Ketheric to keep her alive.Once this is done, head down to the dungeon and find her to trigger this torture scene.

Checkpoint.synopsis: The player is accompanied by Minthara and is stopped by the entrance guards. They do not think Minthara should be allowed to leave.
Checkpoint.how_to_trigger: Go to MoonriseDo execution sceneRescue Minthara from prison areaReach front entrance of Moonrise tower and walk out with player and Minthara.

AD_WelcomingMinthara.synopsis: Minthara has arrived to the torturers room. They are delighted and welcome her before they get to torture her.

DrowFollowing.synopsis: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two drow guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.
DrowFollowing.how_to_trigger: Rescue Minthara from the dungeon in Moonrise Towers, and have her follow you. This dialogue will then trigger when you speak to her as a follower.

AD_TorturersPostTorture.synopsis: Torture scene with Minthara and her torturers is over. This dialog holds two variants, the variant where Minthara is present, therefore she's been pacified mentally and is now an obedient soldier. The other variant is the one where players take over and make the torturers leave by faking that Minthara's pacified.

AD_AttackedTorturers.synopsis: On Minthara's turn, when attacking the torturers.

Torturer2.synopsis: Jasin looks for an excuse to beat the crap out of the prisoners.
Torturer2.how_to_trigger: Complete the torture situation at 634; -669 and speak to NPC after.

Escaped.synopsis: Minthara has escaped Moonrise with the players. She is grateful and offers to move to the player camp.

AD_TorturersInCombat_0.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersInCombat_0.text: Prisoners aren't supposed to fight back!

AD_FailedInterrogation_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_FailedInterrogation_0.text: Break them, before they call for help.
AD_FailedInterrogation_0.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

Torturer1_0.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1_0.text: A new face? Do as the Warden says, when she says, and you'll be fine.

Torturer1_1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1_1.text: The prisoners will say anything to get your attention. Do not acknowledge them.

Torturer1_2.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1_2.text: Apostates must suffer - by your own hand, when needed. It is the Absolute's way.

Torturer1_3.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1_3.text: Minthara sustains the Absolute's unhealing wound.

Torturer1_5.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1_5.text: There will be more traitors still. They too must suffer - see to it.

Torturer1_4.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1_4.text: Let no enemy escape Her justice.

Drow_15.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_15.text: The voice... silenced. And my abusers, dead.
Drow_15.context: NodeContext: wary and exhausted - she just escaped psychic torture

Drow_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_17.text: I expected to be greeted as a hero - but the wretches imprisoned me, and tried to tear my mind apart.

Drow_9.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_9.text: I didn't think anyone would come for me.

Drow_13.speaker: Player
Drow_13.text: What were they doing to you?

Drow_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_3.text: Erasing my thoughts, and my will. Even I could not have endured for much longer.

Drow_18.speaker: Player
Drow_18.text: We need to get out of here.

Drow_11.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_11.text: I will pretend the interrogators finished their work, and feign obedience. They will think me a thrall.

Drow_12.speaker: Player
Drow_12.text: Hide here a while - I'll come back.

Drow_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_8.text: Make haste. I fear that insidious voice will return if I linger here.

Drow_0.speaker: Player
Drow_0.text: I came here for the pleasure of killing you myself.

Drow_10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_10.text: Oh, darling - I wish it hadn't come to this. But the pleasure will be all mine.

Drow_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_5.text: I think not - the pleasure will be all mine.

PAD_HelpMinthara_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HelpMinthara_0.text: Minthara was dragged to the prison in Moonrise. If she's still there, this is our last chance to save her.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_2.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_2.text: The General has descended from his chapel.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_10.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_10.text: To mete out the Absolute's justice, I hear.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_0.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_0.text: I wish we could go upstairs to watch.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_3.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_3.text: When will we have new playthings, sister?

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_5.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_5.text: Soon. Those in the cells are not to be touched, but the Absolute always provides for us.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_7.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_7.text: I hope She brings us someone resilient - the last ones broke too quickly.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_9.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_9.text: We should throw them in the oubliette.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_6.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_6.text: Only if the Warden gives the order.

AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_8.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersBeforeTorture_8.text: Do you hear the Absolute's voice, sister?

AD_PassedInterrogation_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_PassedInterrogation_0.text: We must leave quickly - I cannot hold my fury for long.
AD_PassedInterrogation_0.context: NodeContext: an aside to players - spoken quietly, as she's just avoided detection from guards

Torture_12.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_12.text: You were adored, Minthara. Brought up from the darkness, and into the Absolute's light.
Torture_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over Minthara, speaking serenely and calmly, like a priest giving the last rites, in horrible contrast to the words she's saying

Torture_147.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_147.text: She cherished you. But it wasn't enough - you were distracted by your own desires.

Torture_154.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_154.text: And most damning of all, an unexpected weakness - a longing for acceptance, and affection. From a mortal.

Torture_133.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_133.text: A mortal who disappointed you in ways the Absolute never would.

Torture_146.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: First phrase delivered to torturer Jasin - pained gasp 'hnngnn' is simultaneous with Jasin touching a finger to their temple as they intensify the psychic assaultNodeContext: Through gritted teeth, holding back immense mental agony - cut off abruptly by a wave of psychic agony, which she reacts to with a pained grunt/sob

Torture_136.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_136.text: And most damning of all, an inability to follow orders.

Torture_20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_20.text: I obeyed to the best of my ability.
Torture_20.context: NodeContext: Through gritted teeth, holding back immense mental agony

Torture_162.speaker: Narrator
Torture_162.text: *The drow reaches out to you psychically, connecting with you for a moment. She is infected, like you, and her mind is disintegrating.*

Torture_112.speaker: Narrator
Torture_112.text: *Minthara's mind connects with yours. Not strong, as you remember it, but fractured... disintegrating.*

Torture_153.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_153.text: Come to observe, True Soul? She is a lesson - none can rise so high that they cannot fall again.
Torture_153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning from Minthara to player, having noticed their approach

Torture_186.speaker: Player
Torture_186.text: What are you doing to her?

Torture_102.speaker: Player
Torture_102.text: Yes - I'm looking forward to watching her break.

Torture_4.speaker: Player
Torture_4.text: I expected her to be dismembered. Disappointing.

Torture_106.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_106.text: When the body suffers, we retreat into the mind. But when the mind breaks, all is lost.

Torture_101.speaker: Player
Torture_101.text: I've been instructed to handle this prisoner myself.

Torture_150.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_150.text: Peace, sister. Let us observe the True Soul's methods - perhaps we can learn from them.

Torture_39.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_39.text: Her mind is yours. Break it.
Torture_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: they stand back from Minthara at the end of this line

Torture_176.speaker: Player
Torture_176.text: Reach out for the drow's mind.

Torture_129.speaker: Narrator
Torture_129.text: *Immediately, your mind is swept into a greater vortex. A psionic storm with Minthara at its centre.*
Torture_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mindmelds. Minthara cowers in the same spot, but around her the room blurs like a purple vignette. It is as if she cowers alone, oppressed

Torture_36.speaker: Narrator
Torture_36.text: *Her torturers are not dominating her - they are destroying her mental defences, and exposing her to the presence that claims to be the Absolute.*

Torture_118.speaker: Player
Torture_118.text: Push past the presence, towards Minthara.

Torture_109.speaker: Narrator
Torture_109.text: *The presence pushes back against your intrusion, expanding to occupy every inch of Minthara's mind - until you are forced out.*
Torture_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision of the mindscape fades, and player grimaces in pain as they come back to reality

Torture_13.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_13.text: Weak. You shouldn't have interfered with our work.

Torture_185.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_185.text: The drow's mind is resilient, even now. Do not be ashamed that you could not break it.

Torture_64.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_64.text: None of you will break me.
Torture_64.context: NodeContext: weakening, but still with inner resolve

Torture_173.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_173.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds her hand forward, palm upright, and closes her fingers, as she exerts mental energyNodeContext: Shouted

Torture_98.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: clutches her head in agonyNodeContext: agonised gasp

Torture_125.speaker: Player
Torture_125.text: Shatter her mind. Carve it apart.

Torture_187.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_187.text: What is this - pity? Rebellion? Blasphemy? Stand down, or we will put you down.
Torture_187.context: NodeContext: shock and fury, with heavy emphasis on 'blasphemy'

Torture_11.speaker: Player
Torture_11.text: I'm putting a stop to this.

Torture_132.speaker: Player
Torture_132.text: I don't know what came over me. I am loving your work.

Torture_23.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_23.text: I don't know who you are, True Soul, but under General Thorm's command everybody has their duties. Learn yours, and stick to them.

Torture_57.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_57.text: And we will stick to ours. Goodbye, Minthara.
Torture_57.context: NodeContext: ignoring the argument next to her and focusing on the prisoner - gloating

Torture_157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Torturer Sister holds her hands in front of her, and traces a triangle in the air, then raises her hands. Minthara stands as she raises them, like a marionette with invisible strings.

Torture_166.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_166.text: Hello, Minthara. How do you feel?

Torture_134.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_134.text: Excellent. A job well done, sister.

Torture_169.speaker: Player
Torture_169.text: Push past the presence, towards Minthara.

Torture_58.speaker: Player
Torture_58.text: Push past the presence, towards Minthara.

Torture_121.speaker: Player
Torture_121.text: Acknowledge the presence - ask it to let you pass.

Torture_158.speaker: Narrator
Torture_158.text: *At your familiar touch, the presence withdraws. Still there, you sense, but letting you pass. Waiting.*

Torture_72.speaker: Narrator
Torture_72.text: *Navigating the storm, you reach the nexus of her mind. It is a wound, bleeding raw emotion and shattered memories. But she senses your arrival.*
Torture_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player steps through to join Minthara at the centre - the 'psionic border' dissipates.

Torture_88.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_88.text: You came. I prayed that you would, but there are no gods left to me.
Torture_88.context: NodeContext: feeling a glimmer of hope, despite the terrible situation you're in - speaking to your lover

Torture_144.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_144.text: This thing, that speaks inside me - it has all but destroyed me. But... it fears you.

Torture_163.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_163.text: Even so, I cannot resist it while my tormentors live.

Torture_131.speaker: Player
Torture_131.text: That thing is your precious Absolute - what it truly sounds like.

Torture_78.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_78.text: Whatever it is, I sense it, somewhere below - furious, and hungry.
Torture_78.context: NodeContext: We've told her something devastating - she's rattled, but had her suspicions (next line is her snapping herself out of it)

Torture_120.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_120.text: Quickly. Kill them - we must leave.

Torture_6.speaker: Player
Torture_6.text: Share my strength, and strike the guards down.

Torture_35.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_35.text: I didn't dare hope... I owe you more than my life.

Torture_113.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_113.text: But first, let's make these bastards bleed.

Torture_189.speaker: Narrator
Torture_189.text: *Her mind fills with warmth, and she gently releases you.*
Torture_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mindscape fades, and the player snaps back to reality, where Minthara has risen to her feet, ready to attack the guards

Torture_59.speaker: Player
Torture_59.text: I have a plan - fake obedience, and the guards will leave without raising the alarm.

Torture_110.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_110.text: I would prefer to make these bastards bleed, but I trust that you speak from caution rather than cowardice.

Torture_73.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_73.text: I will put my faith in you, and pretend to be their slave.

Torture_168.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_168.text: Is it done? I did not feel her mind break.

Torture_151.speaker: Player
Torture_151.text: Because I reshaped her. If it is breaking you desire, I can snap you like a twig.

Torture_83.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_83.text: N-no! My sister only meant to compliment your delicate work.

Torture_140.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_140.text: Indeed. Seems I have a bit to learn, yet.

Torture_105.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_105.text: We ought to return to our posts, sister. There'll be plenty more prisoners to practice on.

Torture_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara watches them leave with disgust.

Torture_107.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_107.text: An ill thing, to let an enemy show their back and live.

Torture_161.speaker: Player
Torture_161.text: Let it go. You can plot your revenge once we're free.

Torture_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_14.text: Prudent. Let us go, then - I will be your mute and faithful slave. For now.
Torture_14.context: NodeContext:  'Prudent' is not a compliment. But she relents - a little sarcastically

Torture_90.speaker: Player
Torture_90.text: Seems to me it's back-stabbing that got you where you are.

Torture_28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_28.text: And look at you, right here with me. I suggest we leave - silently.

Torture_117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_117.text: Not an instant longer than I must. Make haste.

Torture_2.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_2.text: Tsk, Minthara. A good little servant does not sulk.

Torture_7.speaker: Player
Torture_7.text: She is cleansed, as ordered. Were my methods too subtle for you?

Torture_99.speaker: Player
Torture_99.text: Look at her. The True Soul Minthara you knew is gone.

Torture_30.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_30.text: She does look a little... vacant, sister.

Torture_1.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_1.text: No more anger, no more doubt. She is perfect.

Torture_126.speaker: Narrator
Torture_126.text: *All it takes is a thought, and Minthara's essence dissolves. You are released from her mind.*
Torture_126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mental landscape fades, Minthara falls to her knees, then fades to nothingness, leaving a white void

Torture_184.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_184.text: Did you feel it, sister? The exquisite snap as her mind gave way.

Torture_0.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_0.text: I did. Well done, True Soul. Minthara - how do you feel?
Torture_0.context: NodeContext: first sentence to his sister, another NPC standing nearby, second line to Minthara, who has been telepathically 'lobotomised'.

Torture_18.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_18.text: We saw the memory of the pain you caused, while she was vulnerable in your arms.

Torture_45.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_45.text: Her feelings for you made her weak - you were cunning to exploit them.

Torture_70.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_70.text: Well done, True Soul. We will put her to work.

Torture_65.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_65.text: We saw her memories of how you spoke with her. And lay with her.

Torture_85.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_85.text: That bond made her vulnerable - you were cunning to exploit it.

Torture_91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_91.text: So it is you who will end me.

Torture_116.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_116.text: Make it swift, then. Anything to silence that thing - that voice.

Torture_138.speaker: Player
Torture_138.text: Push past the presence, towards the drow.

Torture_124.speaker: Narrator
Torture_124.text: *Her torturers are not dominating her - they are destroying her mental defences, and exposing her to something else. The Absolute?*

Torture_95.speaker: Player
Torture_95.text: The only thing I'm going to break is you.

Torture_177.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_177.text: Are you quite mad? Or maybe defective.

Torture_119.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_119.text: You won't break us. And you won't leave here alive.

Torture_74.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_74.text: We do not need assistance. Little of her remains.

Torture_24.speaker: Player
Torture_24.text: Stand aside. I'm taking charge here.

Torture_89.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_89.text: Yes - your authority is great. We can learn, watching you break what little remains of her mind.
Torture_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: they stand back from Minthara at the end of this line

Torture_34.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_34.text: There is little left to take charge of. We have already pushed her mind to the brink - the task is ours to finish.

Torture_96.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Torture_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: looking up at the playerNodeContext: to player, sad, desperate

Torture_183.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_183.text: You're the one she slept beside? Oh, excellent. You open the wound, and we shall press.

Torture_71.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_71.text: She will not be utterly destroyed. What is useful shall remain.

Torture_100.speaker: Player
Torture_100.text: Is this really wise? She's a valuable asset.

Torture_122.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_122.text: Wilful, though. But you are right - whatever is useful, we will leave intact.

Torture_48.speaker: Player
Torture_48.text: This ends now - and so do you.

Torture_16.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torture_16.text: A challenge, sister. Who would be so bold?

Torture_25.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torture_25.text: Offal, sister. Meat that doesn't yet know it is dead.

Torture_160.speaker: Player
Torture_160.text: I hope her punishment won't be too severe - she tried her best.

Checkpoint_4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Checkpoint_4.text: Deal with them. Or I will.
Checkpoint_4.context: NodeContext: aside to player, spoken softly (she doesn't want the 'them' in quetsion to hear, and they're close by)

Checkpoint_7.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_7.text: We heard she'd been escorted from her cell - not that she could leave the tower.

Checkpoint_17.speaker: Adept Merim
Checkpoint_17.text: The General ordered that she be repurposed. Not freed.

Checkpoint_0.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_0.text: She's completely loyal to me. I'll keep her in line.

Checkpoint_18.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_18.text: Creatures like her don't understand the concept of loyalty. Keep her on a tight leash.

Checkpoint_5.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_5.text: And where do your loyalties lie? Not to the Absolute.

Checkpoint_22.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_22.context: NodeContext: calling on nearby guards to help in combat

Checkpoint_13.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_13.text: She goes where I take her - get out of my way.

Checkpoint_1.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_1.text: Apologies, True Soul. Perhaps I misunderstood the General's orders.
Checkpoint_1.context: NodeContext: intimidated by the player ('the True Soul')

Checkpoint_24.speaker: Adept Merim
Checkpoint_24.context: NodeContext: head bowed, avoiding eye contact, intimidated by the player

Checkpoint_16.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_16.text: You overstep your authority - and you stink of treachery.

Checkpoint_8.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_8.text: She's entirely repurposed, and has no will of her own.

Checkpoint_21.speaker: Adept Merim
Checkpoint_21.text: Excellent. Hers was a difficult mind to erase, no doubt - she was fierce, and erratic.

Checkpoint_10.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_10.text: As loyal as a golem. Use her well.
Checkpoint_10.context: NodeContext: admiring the players' control over 'enslaved' Minthara, with a sick smile

Checkpoint_23.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_23.text: And yet, I see a glimmer of her old ferocity behind the eyes. And I hear the lie on your lips.

Checkpoint_9.speaker: Zealot Malik
Checkpoint_9.text: The drow is not to leave the tower.

AD_WelcomingMinthara_2.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_WelcomingMinthara_2.text: Nightwarden Minthara - your dereliction of duty has finally caught up with you.
AD_WelcomingMinthara_2.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

DrowFollowing_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing_5.text: I will speak when I am free.
DrowFollowing_5.context: NodeContext: A dismissal - she's focused on getting out, not chatting with us

DrowFollowing_7.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing_7.text: I will follow you to freedom, not into greater peril. I will hold here until you are done.
DrowFollowing_7.context: NodeContext: Warning that the party are heading toward danger rather than away from it - she will temporarily leave them

DrowFollowing_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing_8.context: NodeContext: Slight edge - she's used to betrayal, and we briefly left her alone in enemy territory. She's nervous, not commanding.

DrowFollowing_9.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing_9.context: NodeContext: Hushed, spike of worry - we're sneaking her out through enemy territory and she's wary of being caught.

DrowFollowing_4.speaker: Player
DrowFollowing_4.text: I need you to wait here.

DrowFollowing_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing_0.text: We're between the Absolute's teeth and you ask me to sit still?
DrowFollowing_0.context: NodeContext: Hushed, incredulous - she wants to be free of this place

AD_TorturersPostTorture_2.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_2.text: Soon, we will be in Baldur's Gate. What say you to that, sister?

AD_TorturersPostTorture_16.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_16.text: A whole city in service of the Absolute - it will be glorious.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_0.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_0.text: And so many minds for us to break.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_5.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_5.text: We should have her fetch our supper from the kitchens.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_18.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_18.text: Or command her to empty the latrines.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_6.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_6.text: It felt good to break a drow.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_7.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_7.text: It is a shame Ravengard didn't pass through our chamber.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_15.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_15.text: Indeed, sister. We could have learned a great deal from him.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_9.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_9.text: And what joy it would be to hear a duke beg for mercy.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_12.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_12.text: When the Sword Coast is ours, we'll set out sights on the Underdark.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_17.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_17.text: We'll find your family, Minthara. And slaughter them. Would you enjoy that?

AD_TorturersPostTorture_14.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_14.text: What will become of Minthara, I wonder.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_1.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_1.text: She will thrive - we helped make her beautiful again.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_20.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_TorturersPostTorture_20.text: Would you bite off your tongue if we commanded you to, Minthara?

AD_TorturersPostTorture_19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_TorturersPostTorture_19.text: Whatever you wish. I live to serve.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_21.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_21.text: It's so tempting - but the Absolute wants her alive.

AD_TorturersPostTorture_10.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_TorturersPostTorture_10.text: Such a pity - the Absolute hates you.

AD_Torture_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Torture_0.text: Queen of Spiders, I beseech of you the strength to destroy my foes.

AD_Torture_2.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_Torture_2.text: Lolth cannot hear you. She has forsaken you.

AD_Torture_7.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_Torture_7.text: There are no gods left to you, Minthara. You are alone.

AD_Torture_5.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_Torture_5.context: NodeContext: taunting, cool and in control

AD_Torture_6.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_Torture_6.text: A blemish in the Absolute's design.

AD_Torture_9.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_Torture_9.text: Do you yet recall your name, prisoner?

AD_Torture_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Torture_8.context: NodeContext: defiant, but subdued: BANE-ray /ˈbeɪnreɪ/ - her surname

AD_Torture_10.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_Torture_10.text: We will take it from you soon.

AD_Torture_11.speaker: Questioner Jasin
AD_Torture_11.text: How can you hope to resist the voice of a god?

AD_Torture_3.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_Torture_3.context: NodeContext: not shouting - a sharp exclamation in shock

AD_AttackedTorturers_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_AttackedTorturers_0.text: You dared scar my mind, I will gut you.
AD_AttackedTorturers_0.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

Torturer2_0.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2_0.text: Plant one foot in front of the other. Head forward, back straight. Make them fear you.

Torturer2_1.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2_1.text: Find a ripe prisoner, and a reason to beat them. I miss the screams.

Torturer2_3.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2_3.text: Minthara has broken. Find another to break - and let me be witness.

Torturer2_4.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2_4.text: Pay the prisoners no mind, and show them no mercy.

Torturer2_5.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2_5.text: I'd bruise every traitor's mind a thousand times over, if the Warden commanded it.

Torturer2_2.speaker: Questioner Jasin
Torturer2_2.text: And I do hope she commands it.

Escaped_11.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_11.text: I last left Moonrise as a commander in the Absolute's army, obeying the voice of a god. I thought I had found a home... and a purpose.
Escaped_11.context: NodeContext: Looking up at the tower we just escaped, speaking with general disgust

Escaped_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_6.text: Now I leave as an exile. But you risked your life to rescue me - for that, I am grateful.

Escaped_3.speaker: Narrator
Escaped_3.text: *The artefact connects with her, pulling your minds together, and showing her all that you have seen.*

Escaped_9.speaker: Narrator
Escaped_9.text: *The Prism, your dream visitor, the protection that keeps you from obeying the Absolute, and becoming illithid. She knows it all in a moment.*

Escaped_2.speaker: Narrator
Escaped_2.text: *Her mind reels, but is no longer clouded. She accepts the truth... she has no choice.*

Escaped_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_0.text: There is much we must discuss. Do you have a safe place to camp nearby?

Escaped_8.speaker: Player
Escaped_8.text: Tell her where to find your camp.

Escaped_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_5.text: Goodbye for now. I will see you soon.

Escaped_21.speaker: Player
Escaped_21.text: I freed you, Minthara, but you're on your own now.

Escaped_18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_18.text: If I leave you, I fear the Absolute's voice will reach me again. And the next time we meet, one of us will die.

Escaped_10.speaker: Player
Escaped_10.text: Correction - when we meet again, you will die.

Escaped_19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_19.text: I admire your confidence. But when you next see me, I may have the Absolute's armies at my back.

Escaped_20.speaker: Player
Escaped_20.text: Then stay out of my way.

Escaped_22.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_22.text: I would - but I fear that without you, I will not be able to choose my own path.

Escaped_4.speaker: Player
Escaped_4.text: No. I only saved you for the pleasure of killing you myself.

Escaped_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_14.text: Vile beast - you are crueller than the cultists.

Escaped_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_17.text: I think not - this time, the pleasure will be all mine.
Escaped_17.context: NodeContext: Disgust and anger - yet again, someone goes against her. Attacks after this line.

Escaped_16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Escaped_16.text: The cult couldn't break me - what chance do you have?
